author: etan_status
content:
<@415109946682769408> <@425572898787426305>  have some test requests for consolidations:
- interactions of concurrent operations, e.g., deposits + withdrawals + consolidations at the same time. e.g., consolidating sets the exit epoch, but one can still deposit into that validator, so what's getting exited may be more than the churn permits. or, what happens if consolidating into a validator that's already exiting, or exiting the target while there are pending consolidations into it, etc.
- interactions with validator rewards. i.e., if I have a staking pool of multiple 32 eth validators, and one gets elected into the next sync committee. how much extra rewards can I cheat if I start consolidating all my validators into the one in the next sync committee right away? rewards are based on the effective balance on that next day. how does it look if I add extra deposits into it during the day before I get the sync duties? how much can be added? is it relevant for issuance? [note this is a new problem, today it is not possible to profitably cheat, because there is no way to profitably change the effective balance as maxeb == min activation balance]
- consolidations seem to transfer effective balance. can there be extra ETH generated if the effective balance is larger than the current balance? e.g., after having missed attestations the balance may be lower than effective balance.
- the request pre-queues in the EL, what happens if pools use consolidations similarly enthusiastic as the BLS to execution change on capella? will gas cost randomly go up to crazy levels while everyone tries to consolidate at the same time? will there be failed txes? do we _really_ want the pre-queue or should it be a flat fee but only limited by gas, same as deposits?
- also related to request pre-queue: the 1559 mechanism has a bug with arithmetic vs geometric mean, so the target is not 50% but can be ~53%. are the new fee markets for pre-queues using the fixed blob formula or the bugged 1559?
